meanings.definition: Make (someone or something) look or feel younger, fresher, or more lively.
meanings.sent1: After a good night's sleep, the fresh air outside helped rejuvenate my energy.
meanings.sent2: Using a moisturizer can help rejuvenate dry skin and make it look healthier.
meanings.sent3: The old car wash was rejuvenated into a trendy cafe, giving it a youthful vibe.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude always manages to rejuvenate the spirits of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers in the garden seemed to rejuvenate the entire backyard with life.

meanings.definition: Give new energy or strength to.
meanings.sent1: A quick power nap can rejuvenate your mind and help you focus better.
meanings.sent2: Drinking a refreshing glass of water can rejuvenate your body after a workout.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's special potion could rejuvenate his powers just in time for the battle.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker's words had the power to rejuvenate the crowd's enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The music at the concert seemed to rejuvenate the audience, lifting their spirits.
